ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: learned about culture and reviewed grammar.
Improved speaking and listening immensely as well as reading comprehension.
I improved my Spanish writing, speaking, and comprehension abilities.

Spanish culture - old myths, stories of immigration, Spanish art, etc.
Revisiting old grammar and language structures
I developed speaking, writing, and listening skills and gained valuable cultural insights.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Homework length and difficulty were generally enough to be productive but still manageable. 
Diversity in projects and assignments was beneficial (between presentations, infographics, essays, videos, etc.)

The upper-level Spanis curriculum I think could use some adjustments. This class was engaging but mostly felt like a slog toward the next unit project. Class participation was usually pretty lacking, and I think more could have been done to facilitate our speaking and listening skills. This class included a lot of writing and observing cultural phenomena in Spanish-speaking countries, which I enjoyed but at times the themes felt incoherent, and I would have preferred if the course worked thematically like an L5 course; with us spending the entire semester with a deep dive into an engaging fixture of Latin American life, rather than the fast-paced survey style of this course.

Strengths: Professor Russell was a highlight, he always brought energy and passion to the class. He also facilitated discussions very well. The material was engaging for the most part, and people were willing to participate.

Weaknesses: Class could be stagnant at times if the material got repetitive. The writing was also a bit stiff sometimes.

strengths: less focus on grammar/sentence structure and general focus on encouraging you to speak up/participate, content is most important which i appreciate

weaknesses: feels rushed at times, not much time to truly engage with the movies or myths that are read

Strengths: Very organized, very interesting, engaging projects and classwork, extremely helpful instructor, multiple media of teaching (visual art, movies, poetry, essays, etc), smaller class size facilitates greater collaboration and camaraderie. I especially enjoyed the cultural insights we gained about underrepresented and marginalized communities. 
Weaknesses (not many): Some of the daily assignments can sometimes feel tedious.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, classroom conversations and assignments are both fun to take part in and extremely beneficial to language acquisition. Inspired me to continue learning Spanish beyond my language requirement.
Grind out your language credits. This course offers good Spanish practice on a day-to-day basis, and is likely to be far better than any high-school Spanish experience.

I would recommend this course to another student. It is a great class if you want to improve your Spanish, and it creates a much more casual environment that emulates the real world. The grading isn't harsh either, so it really allows you to learn without focusing on the grade.
yes - it is hard to learn a language, so getting to this point is super impressive and being able to participate in this class without hyperfixation on grammar/vocabulary made it much more enjoyable
I would 100% recommend this course, as it is very engaging and will allow you to both develop your language skills and learn about the culture of the Spanish-speaking world.
